cscd210Methods

Class CSCD210Lab9Methods

  • java.lang.Object
    • cscd210Methods.CSCD210Lab9Methods

  • public class CSCD210Lab9Methods
extends java.lang.Object
    The methods for this lab. This method focuses on method overloading NOTE: All preconditions and post conditions will be met and all parameters will be passed as final

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CSCD210Lab9Methods()
      Don't write this it is free

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double calcBMI(double height, double weight)
      This method calculates the BMI by taking the height times the height and then dividing the weight by that value and then multiplying that new value by 703

      • CSCD210Lab9Methods

        public CSCD210Lab9Methods()

    • Method Detail

      • readName

        public static java.lang.String readName(java.util.Scanner kb)
        This method reads the persons name from the keyboard. The precondition is the Scanner is not null and also the input buffer has been cleaned from previous method calls. This method ensures the name is not empty
        Parameters:
        kb - The Scanner object representing the keyboard
        Returns:
        String Representing the person's name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null

      • readInfo

        public static double readInfo(java.util.Scanner kb,
                              java.lang.String type)
        This method prompts for the type being passed in. That type is read as a double. If the value is 0.00 or less than zero then the user is reprompted.
        NOTE: if this method is written then the other readInfo will simply call this method and just return the value from the other method call. Also the method will ensure the input buffer is clean
        Parameters:
        kb - The Scanner object representing the keyboard
        type - Representing the String height or weight
        Returns:
        double Representing the value entered for height or weight
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null or if type is null or type is empty

      • readInfo

        public static double readInfo(java.lang.String type,
                              java.util.Scanner kb)
        This method prompts for the type being passed in. That type is read as a double. If the value is 0.00 or less than zero then the user is reprompted.
        NOTE: if this method is written then the other readInfo will simply call this method and just return the value from the other method call. Also the method will ensure the input buffer is clean
        Parameters:
        kb - The Scanner object representing the keyboard
        type - Representing the String height or weight
        Returns:
        double Representing the value entered for height or weight
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if kb is null or if type is null or type is empty

      • displayResults

        public static void displayResults(java.lang.String name,
                                  double height,
                                  double weight,
                                  double bmi)
        This method displays the name, the weight and the height, the BMI and if the person is underweight, normal weight, overweight or obese.
        Parameters:
        name - The person's name
        height - The person's height
        weight - The person's weight
        bmi - The person's BMI
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if name is null or empty or any of the doubles are less than or equal to 0.0

      • calcBMI

        public static double calcBMI(double height,
                             double weight)
        This method calculates the BMI by taking the height times the height and then dividing the weight by that value and then multiplying that new value by 703
        Parameters:
        height - The person's height
        weight - The person's weight
        Returns:
        double Representing the BMI
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either parameter is less than or equal to 0.00
